title: Mont Choungui
text:
Mont Choungui is a distinctively conical <a href="volcano">volcanic mountain</a> in the southern part of the <a href="France">French</a> island of <a href="Mayotte">Mayotte</a>, in the <a href="Comoro%20Islands">Comoro archipelago</a> of the western <a href="Indian%20Ocean">Indian Ocean</a>. It is the second highest point of the island at , the highest being <a href="Benara">Mont Bénara</a>, and is visible from far out at sea.
Important Bird Area.
Choungui dominates the southern peninsula of the island. Its south-easternmost headland, <a href="Pointe%20Saziley">Pointe Saziley</a>, is 4 km long with a sharp ridge rising to 233 m. Forest covers the peak and most of the catchment of the Mroni Bé river, while Sazilé is vegetated with dry <a href="shrubland">shrubland</a> and <a href="thicket">thicket</a>s containing <a href="Adansonia%20digitata">baobabs</a>. The 1600 <a href="hectare">ha</a> site has been identified as an <a href="Important%20Bird%20Area">Important Bird Area</a> (IBA) by <a href="BirdLife%20International">BirdLife International</a> because it supports significant populations of <a href="Comoro%20olive-pigeon">Comoro olive-pigeon</a>s, <a href="Comoro%20blue-pigeon">Comoro blue-pigeon</a>s, <a href="Mayotte%20white-eye">Mayotte white-eye</a>s, <a href="Mayotte%20sunbird">Mayotte sunbird</a>s and <a href="red-headed%20fody">red-headed fodies</a>. It is also home to <a href="Robert%20Mertens%27s%20day%20gecko">Robert Mertens's day gecko</a>s, <a href="Phelsuma%20nigristriata">island day gecko</a>s and <a href="Pasteur%27s%20day%20gecko">Pasteur's day gecko</a>s. Sazilé's beaches are a nesting site for <a href="green%20sea%20turtle">green</a>, and probably <a href="Hawksbill%20sea%20turtle">hawksbill</a>, <a href="sea%20turtle">sea turtle</a>s.
